title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: fully functional except wasn't seeing screen, I cleaned and now just no backlight. Anyone have the schematic or board view? I tried using 820-3536 as everyone else recommends but the bottom where the damage was (U8330) side is different

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: do you have 0v, 12v, or 50v on pin 1 of the lcd connector?

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: Yes just checked and getting 50v and interestingly enough when i put the probe there the screen intermittently illuminates.  After giving it a few minutes it's almost steady now, but the screen is displaying garbage vertical colored lines.  For the hell of it I put on another LCD and LVDS and that seems to be fine, so I guess the guy fried his LCD with the backlight over voltage.

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message:
No Title

I haven't tried taken the shielding off the lcd pcb yet but was wondering if anyone else had and what the prospects for repair that would be (in such a situation like this, because the screen isn't cracked)

and i should have some cracked screens i could salvage the pcbs from

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: 50v means the boost circuit is working but it doesn't see a load. either the lcd cable is bad, the connector on the lcd is bad, or the backlight is bad. it is possible inside the lcd connector on the board is bad as well, but that would be the last place I look

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: thanks louis but like i said, i already confirmed the LCD is fried.  new question is how hard is it to repair lcd pcb and getting those heat shields off?

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: Waste if time to try and fix it. Get an assembly and be done with it.

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message:
This is what i get opening these tabs and trying to post around work. i get beat to making posts!

you are not fixing an lcd PCB, just replace. You can replace the entire assembly, or just the LCD, but fixing the LCD is a waste. i buy the cell for $85 and my receptionist can replace it in a half hour.

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message:
Apparently there is more wrong with this than previously thought.
  [FONT=Helvetica]I thought everything was fine after putting on a new screen.[/FONT]
  [FONT=Helvetica]However that was apparently only running off battery, but not from charger.  With a cord the screen shows the charging battery but never actually does.[/FONT]
  [FONT=Courier][SIZE=7px] [/SIZE][/FONT]
  [FONT=Courier]PPDCIN_G3H[FONT=Times] and[/FONT] HGR_AGATE_DIV both coming in at around 19v with an 85w (assuming) preventing q7180 from opening.  C7185 and R7185 have both been replaced to no avail.  Also tried a new ISL, still doing the same.[/FONT]
  [FONT=Times]Any ideas?[/FONT]

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: Sense resistors around ISL6259, has been discussed many times. Use search function.

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: Thanks!  After testing all of them, found 2 were bad.  Replaced those and still having the same issue though, any further suggestions?

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: which ones where bad???  What is the resistance between pins 17 and 18 from ISL6259???

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: Check resistance between pins 17/18 of ISL6259 and pins 27/28 and report back.

title: 820-4924 liquid spill
message: Was around 4ohm between 17/18 and 20 or so between 27/28.  Replaced C7121 and C7122 and now resistance is 0, but still having the same issue.
